argument.name: options
argument.desc: All animation settings. All properties are optional.

property.name: duration
property.desc: A string or number determining how long the animation will run.

type.name: String
type.desc: The strings "fast" and "slow" can be supplied to indicate durations of 200 and 600 milliseconds, respectively.

property.name: easing
property.desc: A string indicating which easing function to use for the transition.

property.name: complete
property.desc: A function to call once the animation is complete, called once per matched element.

property.name: children
property.desc: Whether the animation should additionally be applied to all descendants of the matched elements. This feature should be used with caution as the cost of determining which descendants to animate can be very expensive, and grows linearly with the number of descendants.

property.name: queue
property.desc: A Boolean indicating whether to place the animation in the effects queue. If false, the animation will begin immediately. A string can also be provided, in which case the animation is added to the queue represented by that string.
